required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effects AZD0530 on Prostate and Breast Cancer Subjects With Metastatic Bone Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomised, Open-Label, Pilot Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effects on Bone Resorption of AZD0530 in Patients With Prostate Cancer or Breast Cancer With Metastatic Bone Disease.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of AZD0530 on subjects with breast cancer or prostate cancer with metastatic bone disease in comparison to zoledronic acid.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum Beta C-terminal Cross-linking Telopeptide of Type I Collagen (betaCTX) at Week 4
primary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum Bone-specific Alkaline Phosphatase (bALP) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum Cross-linked C-terminal Telopeptide of Type I Collagen (ICTP) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum N-terminal Propeptide of Type I Procollagen (PINP) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum Tartrate-resistant Acid Phosphatase 5b (TRAP5b) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Urine N-terminal Cross-linking Telopeptide of Type I Collagen Normalised to Creatinine (NTx/Cr) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Urine Alpha-alpha C-terminal Cross-linking Telopeptide of Type I Collagen Normalised to Creatinine (aaCTx/Cr) at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Saracatinib: Area Under the Curve at Steady State (AUCss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on days 8, 15, 29; 2 hours, 4 hours, 6 hours, 9 hours post dose on day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Previous studies have shown that saracatinib reduces osteoclast function and bone resorption. Bone turnover, the combined result of bone formation and bone resorption, can be assessed in real time by measuring specific markers of bone turnover in serum and in urine. These markers were assessed in a study of patients with metastatic bone disease treated with saracatinib. Specific assays are available to quantitate these markers in serum and urine. In this study the effects of saracatinib on bone turnover were compared with the effects of zoledronic acid, a marketed drug known to inhibit bone resorption in cancer patients with bone metastatses.

arm_group.description: Zoledronic Acid 4 mg on Day 1 of the 4-week treatment period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects 18 years or older with Prostate Cancer or Breast Cancer with Metastatic Bone Disease Have evidence of recurrence or disease progression
- At least one radiographically confirmed metastatic bone lesion
- No change of cancer therapy for at least 8 weeks before randomization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have had any prior exposure to bisphosphonate
- Have had hip fractures or bilateral hip prothesis fracture of any kind or surgery to bone within the past 12 months
- Inadequate renal function or low haemoglobin
- Inadequate liver function as demonstrated by serum bilirubin ≥2 times the upper limits of reference range (ULRR) or by alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase(AST) or ALP ≥2.5 times the ULRR (≥5 times the ULRR in the presence of liver metastases). If bone metastases are present and liver function is otherwise considered adequate by the investigator then elevated ALP will not exclude the patient.

clinical_study.keyword: Subjects with breast cancer or prostate cancer with metastatic bone disease

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Randomised=full analysis set: AZD0530 175mg=69, Zoledronic acid 4mg=70; safety set: AZD0530 175mg=68, Zoledronic acid 4mg=69

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 4 mg
group.description: Zoledronic Acid 4 mg on Day 1 of the 4-week treatment period

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Dev. of study specific discon. criteria

group.title: Zoledronic Acid 4 mg
group.description: Zoledronic Acid 4 mg on Day 1 of the 4-week treatment period

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in Serum Beta C-terminal Cross-linking Telopeptide of Type I Collagen (betaCTX) at Week 4
outcome.description: Result at Week 4 minus result at baseline as a percentage of the result at baseline, based on log transformed data. Back transformation of the least squares (LS) mean.
outcome.population: The number of participants analyzed reflected the number of paired serum samples per participant that yielded valid assay results, not the total number of participants or completers. The number of evaluable paired serum samples will therefore be a subset of the total number of participants.

outcome.title: Saracatinib: Area Under the Curve at Steady State (AUCss)
outcome.description: Previous studies have shown that saracatinib reduces osteoclast function and bone resorption. Bone turnover, the combined result of bone formation and bone resorption, can be assessed in real time by measuring specific markers of bone turnover in serum and in urine. These markers were assessed in a study of patients with metastatic bone disease treated with saracatinib. Specific assays are available to quantitate these markers in serum and urine. In this study the effects of saracatinib on bone turnover were compared with the effects of zoledronic acid, a marketed drug known to inhibit bone resorption in cancer patients with bone metastatses.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on days 8, 15, 29; 2 hours, 4 hours, 6 hours, 9 hours post dose on day 29

Bone turnover, the combined result of bone formation and bone resorption, can be assessed in real time by measuring specific markers of bone turnover in serum and in urine. These markers were assessed in a study of patients with metastatic bone disease treated with saracatinib. Specific assays are available to quantitate these markers in serum and urine. In this study the effects of saracatinib on bone turnover were compared with the effects of zoledronic acid, a marketed drug known to inhibit bone resorption in cancer patients with bone metastatses.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a Study Site, or an investigator, requests permission to publish data from this study, any such publication (including oral presentations) is to be agreed with AstraZeneca prior to publication.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Non-compliant patients were excluded from the biomarker analysis, in order to accurately assess effects due to treatment. The compliance criteria did not apply to the zoledronic acid arm, which led to an imbalance in the number of subjects analysed.
